main event: A crescent-shaped silver object was observed in the sky over the Republic of Korea on October 19, 1959.
interesting points: The object was approximately the size of the letter 'c' on the reverse side of a penny held at arm's length.
The object moved very slowly toward the west and was visible for over 3 hours and 20 minutes.
The object's movement and position in the sky matched that of the planet Venus at the time.
An observer obtained very precise data on the object's bearing and altitude using a telescope.
Air Force aircraft were scrambled to investigate the sighting but did not spot the object.
result: The object was likely the planet Venus.
photographs: No photographs included in the report
